page_summary: This page provides clinical background on the pathological diagnosis, classification, and treatment of noninvasive and early-stage breast cancer, covering procedures such as biopsy, sentinel lymph node biopsy, and axillary lymph node dissection. It details types of noninvasive breast cancer (LCIS and DCIS), the typical patient workup, and treatment modalities such as lumpectomy, mastectomy, neoadjuvant, adjuvant, endocrine, targeted, and radiation therapies. The discussion emphasizes clinical practice and management strategies but does not define or specify any clinical trial endpoints.
